Title: Electrophotocatalytic oxygenation of multiple adjacent C–H bonds
Summary: Installation of multiple C–O bonds by concurrent oxygenation of contiguous C–H bonds in a selective fashion is highly desirable, and this is achieved by repeated operation of a potent oxidative catalyst via electrophotocatalysis.

Title: Boron-catalysed hydrogenolysis of unactivated C(aryl)–C(alkyl) bonds
Summary: Hydrogenolysis of unactivated C(aryl)–C(alkyl) bonds is a challenging task even in the presence of metal catalysts. Now, an approach using a boron catalyst is described that facilitates the hydrogenolysis of alkylarenes under mild conditions, and its utility is demonstrated by degrading polystyrene waste into benzene and phenylalkanes.

Title: Ni-catalyzed benzylic β-C(sp3)–H bond activation of formamides
Summary: The development of 3d-metal-catalyzed β-C–H bond activation via 4-membered metallacycles remains an elusive challenge. Here, the authors report a Ni-Al bimetal-catalyzed β-C(sp3)–H bond activation of formamides via 4-membered nickelacycles.

Title: Chemoselective carbene insertion into the N−H bonds of NH3·H2O
Summary: Converting low-cost inorganic chemicals into value-added organic chemicals is a longstanding goal in chemistry. Here the authors describe a silver-catalysed chemoselective carbene N−H insertion reaction, providing access to primary amines from aqueous ammonia and diazo compounds.

Title: Cu-catalysed enantioselective radical heteroatomic S–O cross-coupling
Summary: Heteroatom–heteroatom cross-couplings have so far remained elusive. Now, a copper-catalysed enantioselective S–O cross-coupling of diverse diols or triols with sulfonyl chlorides has been realized via a single-electron reductive elimination manifold. The reaction provides access to value-added chiral C3 building blocks and inositol phosphates through enantioselective desymmetrization of biomass-derived alcohols.

Title: Electrically conductive hybrid organic crystals as flexible optical waveguides
Summary: The poor conductivity of organic crystals hinders their potential on applications in flexible electronics, wearable devices, and soft robotics. Here, Naumov et al. develop a hybrid organic crystal that shows enhanced electrical conductivity and fast mechanical deformation due to temperature change.

Title: Enantio- and diastereoselective construction of vicinal C(sp3) centres via nickel-catalysed hydroalkylation of alkenes
Summary: Simultaneous stereochemical control of two vicinal C(sp3) stereocentres from two reaction partners is challenging. Now, this is achieved in a nickel-catalysed enantio- and diastereoselective cross-coupling reaction of internal alkenes with racemic alkyl bromides.

Title: Iron-mediated ligand-to-metal charge transfer enables 1,2-diazidation of alkenes
Summary: Alkene diazidations represent a promising strategy for the synthesis of 1,2-diamines. Here, the authors report a protocol that enables alkene diazidation via iron-mediated ligand-to-metal charge transfer, providing a versatile platform to access structurally diverse diazides without using external oxidants.

Title: A synergistic Rh(I)/organoboron-catalysed site-selective carbohydrate functionalization that involves multiple stereocontrol
Summary: Asymmetric systems for catalytic carbohydrate functionalization are mostly limited to chiral copper complexes and organocatalysts. Now, a synergistic chiral Rh(I)- and organoboron-catalysed site-selective functionalization of carbohydrate polyols has been developed, giving stereocontrolled access to biologically relevant arylhydronaphthalene glycosides. Enantio-, diastereo-, regio- and anomeric control and dynamic kinetic resolution were found to be concomitantly operative.

Title: Photoprogrammable circularly polarized phosphorescence switching of chiral helical polyacetylene thin films
Summary: ‘Pure organic room-temperature phosphorescence (RTP) materials with circularly polarized luminescence (CPL) gained increasing interest. Here, the authors propose a photoinduced circularly polarized RTP material by homogeneously dispersing phosphorescent chiral polyacetylenes into a processable polymer matrix.
